francis2k2 :

to fix the problem you're having, be sure to adjust the windows compatibility to windows 98. You do this by finding the exe.file called "GRIM" , rightclic on it, and under the second tab "compatibility" select windows 98. I got the same error message as you at first, but this absolutely fixes it, and the game runs great!

The message for my self...

Ok, I do know how to install games, how to use daemon, etc, but I encountered ''newish'' problem here: mounting goes fine, installation starts and than everything crashes and iso unmounts itself from daemon (I can see cd mounted in daemon, but my computer doesn't). Tried making 1 iso file or at least copying extracted files or anything, but found out that DATA003.LAB from cd1 and VOX002.LAB from cd2 are ones I can't even copy. So, I can't do a thing... So sad :((( I downloaded this game some time ago, but couldn't play (didn't have those new solutions for newer OPs back than). Now I think I could play it, but can't get it installed. Frustrating!

This message appears right before everything goes wrong:
''C:/Program Files/Grim Fandango/DATA003.LAB

An error occurred while trying to copy a file:
The device is not ready.

Click Retry to try again, Ignore to skip this file (not recommended), or Abort to cancel installation.''

After this I can only go with Abort...

Just for anyone having trouble mounting/installing, I had to do the following:
-Mount CD1 to any drive (I used drive E), but do not run it once mounted
-Run the setup instead that comes in this torrent
-The setup should prompt you to insert CD2 into a drive about halfway through installation
-So unmount CD1 from the drive and then mount CD2 to that same drive (it could not find CD2 if it was in a different drive from the once CD1 was in)
-Then you can successfully play the game

Everything about the game works fine, except the menu and text. It's impossible to read and just looks like little marks in a line...I've tried running in compatibility mode but that doesn't fix the problem.
working on win 7 .. thx for the great game i hope they make a film from this!

If anyone has Nvidia Optimus on their laptops and has trouble seeing the text in the game, go to the Nvidia Control Panel and change the preferred graphics card to the integrated one whenever you want to play this game and the game will run fine.

For Win 7 64-bit users with freezing or crashing problems:

Go to the properties of the new launcher and put the compatibility mode to Window 95, that fixed everything for me, try it out.
Thx Scunthorpex!
